results.title: Miscarriage and stillbirth
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
Miscarriage, although not uncommon, is a cause of deep grief and shock among women who have experienced it. With stillbirth, the grief often runs deeper for those women who are already mothers. In this video woman is interviewed who has experienced miscarriages and a stillbirth. Through her story we are able to understand more clearly the psychological needs of bereaved women and the resultant impact on women’s health when these are not met.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions

results.title: Infertility and adoption
results.creator_credit: Tony Vuletich, Margaret Nicol and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
Infertility is perhaps the most unacknowledged and painful grief in our society - truly the death of a dream. While addressing major psychological issues encountered by infertile women, this programme also discuuses the option of medical intervention by outlining the benefits, the additional stress it can cause and the impact on relationships.

results.title: Paris: living space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Cities”.
A fascinating documentary that looks at the development and expansion of Paris. The film looks at the growth of the city in organised patterns and it also looks at the various people, throughout history, who influenced the design of Paris.

results.title: The City of the future
results.creator_credit: Art Ciocco, Edmund Bacon and Urban Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Cities”.
A documentary that looks at the future design and development of the cities in the world. Factors that will influence these future designs include the limited amounts of energy and resources that are left in the world. Narrated by Edmund Bacon.

results.title: The Garden of roses
results.brief_description: At Geelong Hospital there is a garden of peace, opened in 2001, to commemorate all medical staff who have served their country in war and peace. This is Ted’s story (a Korean veteran) of his involvement and pride in being associated with this special garden of reflection and remembrance.
